properties.description: Example: ASC29001
properties.title: ASC Number

properties.description: The identifier_citation includes a folder number in brackets after the accession number. i.e. 1974-001 / 086 (557)
properties.title: Box number

properties.description: Prints usually have multiple folders for one folder number. If so, indicate which folder it is here. i.e. Folder 1 of 4
properties.title: Identifier Other

properties.description: Always use the title written on the envelope that contains the print. This title is also written partially on the order sheet. i.e. Atomic Bombs
properties.title: Title

properties.description: This field is used when some words in title written on the folder are abbreviated. Put the full form of abbreviated words in square brackets. i.e. If “Can. Imperial Bank of Commerce” is written on the envelope, enter “Can. Imperial Bank of Commerce” in title, and “[Canadian] Imperial Bank of Commerce [CIBC]” in title_alternative field. Note: This field can contain either full or part of title depends on how title is abbreviated, and you can always check the Abbreviation & full form mapping list for full spelling of words.
properties.title: Sub Title

properties.description: Follow the Tips for describing archival materials sheet posted in the office. If you are scanning for an order, more detail is required, especially if you are scanning multiple photos that look similar. Find one different thing in each of the similar photos and include it in the description.
properties.title: Description

properties.description: Enter the surname of the person on the order form. i.e. O’Brian. If you are scanning for archival preservation purposes, enter “ASC Red Dot”
properties.title: Researcher

properties.description: Select "Personal" if a photographer's name is mentioned on the back of the print i.e. Pete Ward. Select "Corporate" if you see the name of a company on the back of the print, i.e. AP Wirephoto
properties.title: Type

properties.description: Enter the name of the photographer on the assignment envelope. i.e. Sale If you are not sure of the spelling of the photographer’s name, double-check the Tele S If there is no name on the assignment envelope, enter: [Telegram staff] using the square brackets.
properties.title: Name

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Type

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Name

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: You may not have this information…its likely only to appear with wire service photographs! This is the date the photo was taken which would appear on an accompanying paper, next to the photo credit. Please write it out longhand without punctuation in the following format DD Month YYYY 03 November 1965
properties.title: Date Issued (free text)

properties.description: Date the print was used. This is stamped on the back of the print. If there is more than one stamp, use the earlier date and ignore the older one. If you can only make out one of the dates, then enter the one you can see here. i.e. 1955-04-22 (If you don't have the day, you can leave it off, i.e. 1955-04 and if you don't have the month, you can enter only the year, i.e. 1955)
properties.title: Date Issued (iso)

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Publisher

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Country

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Place

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Type of Resource

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Genre

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Language

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Form

properties.description: Always measure the dimensions of the photograph in cm. Note that cm is only typed once in the example below. 1 photograph : b&w photoprint ; 21.4 x 13.5 cm
properties.title: Format

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Relation

properties.description: Not Applicable, unless you’re dealing with an item that was previously scanned. In that case, look at the ASC Already Scanned Workflow. Note: Julia also uses this field to note related items. (relation-isformatof)
properties.title: Related material

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: Title

properties.description: Ignore.
properties.title: url

properties.description: Please derive the subject from the assignment envelope, or, the general subject heading as determined in the finding aid. If you are not sure, look at the pdf file copy of the finding aid and locate the subject heading.
properties.title: Subject

properties.description: Name of a country, i.e. a political entity considered a country.
properties.title: Country

properties.description: Includes first order political divisions called provinces within a country, e.g. in Canada.
properties.title: Province

properties.description: Includes regions that have status as a jurisdiction, usually incorporating more than one first level jurisdiction.
properties.title: Region

properties.description: Name of the largest local administrative unit in various countries, e.g. England.
properties.title: County

properties.description: Name of an inhabited place incorporated as a city, town, etc.
properties.title: City

properties.description: Name of a smaller unit within a populated place, e.g., neighborhoods, parks, or streets.
properties.title: City Section

properties.description: Please put coordinates in decimal format: 43.653333, -79.383889 -- NOT degree format 43°39′12″N 079°23′02″W

properties.default_value: For further copyright information contact : ascproj@yorku.ca

index.key: Photograph now in public domain. For citation information or to obtain high resolution image, contact ascproj@yorku.ca or see Toronto Telegram FAQ.

options.index: Photograph taken by Toronto Telegram photographer before 1962?

index.key: Copyright owned by York University. For permission to publish or other copyright questions, contact ascproj@yorku.ca

options.index: Photograph taken by Toronto Telegram photographer on/or after 1962?

index.key: Copyright owned by photographer. For more information see Toronto Telegram FAQ.
Copyright owned by wire service. For more information contact, ascproj@yorku.ca

properties.title: Usage rights

properties.description: Note that in the case of prints, we likely will not have the right to display them in the repository. These items will often need to be hidden from public view.
properties.title: Access restrictions
